verb.description: Avoid making a decision or committing oneself in order to gain time.
examples: the opportunity was missed because the mayor still temporized

verb.description: Temporarily adopt a particular course in order to conform to the circumstances.
examples: their unwillingness to temporize had driven their country straight into conflict with France

origin: Late 16th century: from French temporiser bide one's time, from medieval Latin temporizare to delay, from Latin tempus, tempor- time.
